one.transcript: Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is the vessel Sea Turtle. We are taking on water five miles west of Catalina Island. There are three crew on board, request immediate assistance.

expected.position: five miles west of Catalina Island

two.transcript: This is Blue Horizon. We've run aground near the Needles Lighthouse. Two injured, five total onboard.

three.transcript: Distress call from Lady Anne. We're adrift off the coast of Falmouth. No injuries. Crew of six. Engine failure.

four.transcript: Pan-pan call. This is sailing vessel Aurora Dawn. We’re located approximately 53°N, 1°W. Water ingress under control. Four persons onboard.

five.transcript: Yeah hi, this is John from the fishing boat Bonnie Jean. We’ve lost power off Holyhead, no one's hurt, three of us total.

six.transcript: Vessel name unknown. Taking on water. Location unclear. Crew of unknown size. Please advise.

seven.transcript: This is Mayfly, hit something underwater, and we’re listing badly. Two adults, one child onboard. Unsure of exact position. Minor injuries reported.

eight.transcript: SOS from catamaran Luna Tide. Position 49.3 N 2.1 W. One person unconscious. Total five crew. Taking on water fast.

nine.transcript: Mayday Mayday Mayday – Yacht Seraphim requesting immediate tow. Engine failure, near Plymouth Harbour. Two aboard.

ten.transcript: Fisherman here. No boat name given. We're drifting, GPS says 50°12'N, 1°45'W. Weather worsening. Four onboard. All safe.

eleven.transcript: Calling for help – this is Windchaser. Hit a submerged object near Brighton Pier. Taking on water. Three adults. No injuries reported.
